newsitem.title: GERMANY: German call money edges higher to 3.05/10 pct.
newsitem.headline: German call money edges higher to 3.05/10 pct.

text.p: German call money edged slightly higher to 3.05/10 percent on Thursday from 3.03/08 percent on Friday, pushed higher in part by demand from public authorities for cash to meet regular interest payments.
But dealers were unconcerned by the rise and said they expected rates to ease back again later today.
Bank reserve holdings with the central bank eased to 42.4 billion marks on Wednesday from 43.2 billion on Tuesday, for an average of 40.8 billion for the first 19 days of the month.
Lombard borrowings totalled about 100 million marks on Thursday.
The Frankfurt Interbank Overnight Average FIONA= was calculated at 3.10625 on Thursday after 3.10967 on Wednesday.
